intro: Erophila tenuis, commonly known as slender erophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Erophila tenuis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
